  • Management interface

Management interfaceğŸ”—

The VisionAppster Engine provides a web-based management interface that is accessible through the built-in web server. By default, the server is bound to port 2015. If you have the Engine running locally, http://localhost:2015/ should take you to the front page.

The Builder provides the same management interface in its built-in web server. It uses a different address by default: http://localhost:2020/. It should be noted that a system-wide service installation and the Builder use a different component databases. Installing a component to one does not make it available in the other. If you want to install a component for development use in the Builder, use port 2020. Otherwise, use port 2015.

The front page lists installed apps and web apps.ğŸ”—

Installed apps can be started by clicking the â€œStartâ€ button. The API objects published by started apps are listed on the â€œAPISâ€ page. Clicking the API links will let you to inspect the structure of the API objects. The â€œTestâ€ button opens a visual API tester.

The APIS page lists published API objects.ğŸ”—

Installed components can be managed on the â€œMANAGEâ€ page. To upload .vapkg files, drop them on the upload control or click to it to select a file from your computer. A .vapkg file can contain components, licenses or both.

Drag and drop .vapkg files to upload them.ğŸ”—

To install a package, mark it and click the â€œInstallâ€ button. To prevent accidental actions, you will be required to click the button again after a while.

All marked packages will be installed with at once.ğŸ”—

Note: Uninstalling or upgrading components containing Python code may not have the desired effect because the Python interpreter cannot unload modules. After installation, you may need to restart the Engine.
